item.title: Mentioned by Waterloo Record
item.description:
Wellington MP joins backbench revolt against stifling party discipline
Two more Tories — Wellington-Halton Hills MPs Michael Chong and Glengarry-Prescott-Russell MP Pierre Lemieux — joined the chorus of complaints Monday as Parliament resumed business after the Easter break. They threw their support ... “It would indeed be an infringement on the rights and privileges of a member of Parliament if members were not able to rise to clarify their positions on such important matters or to give voice to the concerns of their constituents,” Lemieux told the Commons. The Canadian Press ...

item.title: Mentioned by Globe and Mail
item.description:
Two more Tory MPs agitate for freedom of speech in House
... challenge the Prime Minister's Office's iron grip over what caucus members can say in the chamber. One is Pierre Lemieux, an Eastern Ontario MP who is also an assistant to a cabinet minister. He's parliamentary secretary to the Minister of Agriculture.
